text:
Thanks <@UAYBXDG4U>, looking forward to the announcement then :smile: 

<@U05CAJG8D98> Got it, yeah I see why.

Since CMS React came out last year one of the biggest gripes I had with it was the separation of modules and themes. So it's good to know the team is working on it :)

Hello everyone. There is a problem:
After the first `npm run deploy` everything works as normal
But if you make changes in the `templates` folder and then deploy, the build and deploy are successful, but when selecting templates, the templates are *missing*.
If you make changes in `components`, for example in the Header module and do not make any changes in `templates` after the first deploy, then everything works as before.
I create a copy of the template only with a different name and still an error
In general, the problem is only when changing templates and subsequent deploy
Deployment of other projects also does not display templates until you delete everything and do the first deployment
Maybe someone knows what the problem is?

There is also a problem that changes are not displayed on the Proxy page. After saving the changes in the file, the following message is displayed in the console: `Skipping C:\Users\admin\Desktop\new\cms-react\examples\getting-started-project-theme\src\getting-started-theme\components\WeatherCards.tsx due to unsupported extension`.Help me pls)
If you are for templates, then when creating a page or selecting when the page is already created
The type of `ModuleProps<T>` includes a couple url variations called `urlWithQuery` and `urlWithoutQuery`. How do I get those to be present in my component’s props?

I can see where the `getServerSideProps` export supplies something similar on `props.serverSideProps`, but it is broken in local development. (I am working around it for now). I figure if there is a dedicated url I can access in the root of the props object, perhaps that one won’t be broken in the dev server.
